>So if two or more were >.5, you took the highest?

No, I took them all together. So up+left was diagonal; up+down meant no net
vertical motion; etc.

>Did the networks tend to converge to a particular
>movement pattern (like spiraling clockwise or
>counterclockwise)?

Generally, iirc, they went orthogonally straight for a bit until they hit
the edge of a shape, diagonally across it until they hit an opposite edge,
then orthogonally again to another edge, then made the decision. That seemed
to be the general way they did it.

>That's interesting.  Have you published these results
>somewhere?

Not other than here. I could send you the experiments.cpp file if you wanted
to play with it a bit.

--Darren
